item.title: Authors
item.description: These fantastic folks volunteered their time and skills to create this Open Source Technical Writing Course for Beginners. It’s packed with useful stuff and totally FREE for everyone!

item.title: Intro to technical writing
item.description: Table of Contents What is technical writing? Different types of technical documentation The audience for technical documentation The purpose of technical documentation The technical writing process What is technical writing?

item.title: Information gathering
item.description: Learn how to find the knowledge you need for your documentation.

item.title: Writing for User Experience (UX)
item.description: Understanding user experience (UX) prinicples and how to implement them in technical writing.

item.title: Writing style guide
item.description: Understanding the importance of style guides and how to create one.

item.title: Use of diagrams
item.description: This article explains the use of diagrams in technical documentation. It also provides tips for creating effective diagrams and do’s and don’ts for using images in technical documentation.

item.title: Using Technical Writing Tools
item.description: This article explains the various types of technical writing software available in the market and how they can aid the writing process.

item.title: Editing
item.description: Editing is a vital aspect of the technical writing process. It gives technical document accuracy, consistency, clarity, and better user comprehension.

item.title: Formatting
item.description: Module content In this Module, you will learn: Headings Example of good and bad headings Lists Tables Figures and Images How to use formatting to improve the readability and clarity of your technical documentation Formatting - Definition Formatting refers to how visually organized a document is arranged on the page.
